topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0 Carrier Grade Beta: Installing Infoblox

body.p: Infoblox is an optional component of the Memphis and Sacramento deployments.

The Infoblox OpenStack Adapter (IOA) integrates with the OpenStack Neutron networking service, to provide IP Address Management (IPAM) networking services within OpenStack cloud platforms.Refer to the Infoblox documentation for operation and maintenance information.
You will need to purchase a license from Infoblox before installing.
If you are not installing Infoblox, go to Launching the Horizon Interface.

p.b: Deploy and Configure Infoblox Openstack Adapter (IOA) VM in ESX

section.p: Infoblox vNIOS™ (Network Infrastructure Operating System) for VMware® allows deployment of a virtualized instance of an Infoblox appliance. You can use ESX vCenter to import the template and deploy the Infoblox IOA VM.

To deploy the template in ESX:
Launch the VMware vCenter client.
Click File, then Deploy OVF Template.
In the Deploy OVF Template wizard, browse to the location of the your template file. You should have received a template file when you purchased Infoblox.
Click Next and complete the wizard:
Review the details for the installation and click Finish.

ol.li: Power on vNIOS VM.
Login to VM console from vCenter using the default credentials (admin/infoblox)
Run command set network to configure IP address of vNIOS
Run the set temp_license command to configure trial license (60 days). Choose option 8 Or, obtain a permanent license from Infoblox.
Point a browser to the default Infoblox URL at https://10.200.51.240/ui/.

Log into the Infoblox portal using the default credentials admin/infoblox.
When you login for the first time you will be prompted for intial setup select options. Proceed through the setup wizard.
Go to Administration > Extensible Attributes and click Configure Extensible Attributes.

Create the following extensible attributes:
Name Type Comments
Account String UserID inOpenStack
CMP Type String CMPtypes(OpenStack)
Cloud API Owned String Cloud API Owned
Is External String For networks and network containers only
Is Shared String For networks and network containers only
IP Type String Typeof IP address
Network Encap String
Network ID String NetworkID inOpenStack
Network Name String Networkname
PhysicalNetworkName String
Port Attached Device - Device ID String
Port Attached Device - Device Owner String
Port ID String
Segmentation ID String
Subnet ID String Subnet ID in OpenStack
Subnet Name String Subnet name in OpenStack
Tenant ID String TenantID in OpenStack
Tenant Name String Tenant Name in OpenStack
VLAN ID Integer The VLANID in OpenStack
VM ID String InstanceID in OpenStack
VM Name String Virtual machine instance name inOpenStack

section.title: Deploy the Infoblox Plug-Ins
section.p: An Infoblox plug-in needs to be installed on the HLM host. For the Sacramento deployment, the plug in also needs to be installed on the baremetal controller.

p.b: To deploy the plug-in on the HLM host:

ol.li: Log into the HLM host.
Copy the infoblox.tar.gz patch to: /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/plugins.

Change to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/plugins directory.
Where <cloudname> is the name of the cloud.
Use the following command to extract the patchtar -zvxf infoblox.tar.gz

Modify the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/plugins/infoblox/configure.json based on your environment:
ioa_ipaddress: CLM IP of infoblox Openstack Adapter (IOA) VM.
ioa_username: Username to login to IOA. Default username is admin.
ioa_password: Password to login to IOA. Default password for user admin is infoblox.
certfile_path: certfile path as defined in stackrc file.
region_name: Region Name where the plugin will be deployed: Memphis or Sacramento.

Execute following command to apply patch: ansible-playbook -i hosts deploy-infoblox.yml
To deploy the plug-in on the baremetal region controller:
Log into the baremetal controller.
Copy the infoblox.tar.gz patch to: /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/plugins.

Change to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/plugins directory.
Where <cloudname> is the name of the cloud.
Use the following command to extract the patchtar -zvxf infoblox.tar.gz

Modify the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/plugins/infoblox/configure.json based on your environment:
ioa_ipaddress: CLM IP of infoblox Openstack Adapter (IOA) VM.
ioa_username: Username to login to IOA. Default username is admin.
ioa_password: Password to login to IOA. Default password for user admin is infoblox.
certfile_path: certfile path as defined in stackrc file.
region_name: Region Name where the plugin will be deployed: Memphis or Sacramento.
Execute following command to apply patch: ansible-playbook -i hosts deploy-infoblox.yml

section.p: Edit the following configuration files on the HLM VM and on the baremetal controller.

p.b: To modify the configutation files on the HLM VM:

ol.li: Log into the HLM VM.

Modify the /etc/neutron/neutron.conf file with values appropriate for your environment. For example:[keystone_authtoken] auth_url = http://BUILD19-CCP-T2-VIP-INTF0-1551:35357
[DEFAULT]
ipam_driver = neutron.ipam.drivers.infoblox.infoblox_ipam.InfobloxIPAM infoblox_members_config = /etc/neutron/infoblox_members.conf conditional_config = /etc/neutron/infoblox_conditional.conf use_host_records_for_ip_allocation = False bind_dns_records_to_fixed_address = record:a,record:aaaa,record:ptr unbind_dns_records_from_fixed_address = record:a,record:aaaa,record:ptr delete_dns_records_associated_with_fixed_address = record:a,record:aaaa,record:ptr,record:txt subnet_shared_for_creation = true subnet_shared_for_deletion = true infoblox_wapi = https://10.200.51.240/wapi/v2.0/ infoblox_username = admin infoblox_password = infoblox
nova_admin_username = nova nova_admin_password = {{ NOV_API.consumes_KEY_API.vars.keystone_nova_password }} nova_admin_tenant_id = {{ tenant_id.stdout }} nova_admin_tenant_name = services
[nova] # PEM encoded client certificate cert file certfile = /etc/stunnel/ssl/hlm/certs/ca.crt
# Name of nova region to use. Useful if keystone manages more than one region.
region_name = Memphis

Modify the /etc/neutron/infoblox_conditional.conf file with values apprapriate for your environment. For example: [ { "condition": "subnet_range:10.100.1.0/24", "is_external": false, "network_view": "management", "disable_dhcp": true, "dhcp_members": "infoblox.localdomain", "require_dhcp_relay": false, "domain_suffix_pattern": "{subnet_name}.cloud.global.com", "hostname_pattern": "{instance_name}-{ip_address}" }, { "condition": "tenant", "is_external": false, "network_view": "{tenant_name}", "disable_dhcp": true, "dhcp_members": "infoblox.localdomain", "require_dhcp_relay": false, "domain_suffix_pattern": "{subnet_name}.cloud.global.com", "hostname_pattern": "{instance_name}-{ip_address}" }, { "condition": "global", "is_external": true, "network_view": "default", "disable_dhcp": true, "dhcp_members": "infoblox.localdomain", "require_dhcp_relay": false, "domain_suffix_pattern": "{subnet_name}.cloud.global.com", "hostname_pattern": "{instance_name}-{ip_address}" } ]

Create the /etc/neutron/infoblox_members.conf file with the following line to include IOA VM IP address.
[{"ipv4addr": "10.200.51.240", "name": "infoblox.localdomain"}]
Note: In this example, 10.200.51.240 is the CLM IP of the IOA VM running in the ESX environment which was provided during IOA configuration.

section.b: To modify the configutation files on the baremetal controller:

ol.li: Log into the baremetal controller.
Modify the /etc/neutron/neutron.conf file with values appropriate for your environment. See the previous example.
Modify the /etc/neutron/infoblox_conditional.conf file with values apprapriate for your environment. See the previous example.

Create the /etc/neutron/infoblox_members.conf file with the following line to include IOA VM IP address.
[{"ipv4addr": "10.200.51.240", "name": "infoblox.localdomain"}]
Note: In this example, 10.200.51.240 is the CLM IP of the IOA VM running in the ESX environment which was provided during IOA configuration.
Point a browser to the default Infoblox URL at https://10.200.51.240/ui/.
Log into the Infoblox portal using the default credentials admin/infoblox.
Go to Administration > Network views. The subnet pool should be listed.
